issue.title: Modifier for %d parse flag does not match POSIX and format specification

discussion.p:
Currently, the '%d' parse flags accepts the 'E' modifier to parse the locale's alternative representation, see Table 88 —
"Meaning of parse flags":

blockquote.p: The modified command %Ed interprets the locale's alternative representation of the day of the month.

discussion.p: This is inconsistent with the POSIX strftime specification and the format functions, that uses 'O' to output alternate locale representation. Per Table 87 — "Meaning of format conversion specifiers":

blockquote.p: The modified command %Od produces the locale's alternative representation.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4810.

li.p: Modify , Table 88 — "Meaning of parse flags", as indicated:

tr.td: The day of the month as a decimal number. The modified command %N d specifies the maximum number of characters to read. If N is not specified, the default is 2. Leading zeroes are permitted but not required. The modified command %EOd interprets the locale's alternative representation of the day of the month.
